Each side separately, entire globe
Each side separately
Each side separately, upper and lower lid as 1 structure
Each side separately
Each side separately, include at least 3 CT slices
Superiorly from incisura, midbrain and pons only, 1 structure
Entire bony canal including at least 10 cm superior and inferior to PTV
Each parotid gland separately

Starting 1 cm above first appearance of true vocal cord, includes entire cord, arytenoid muscles, corniculate and arytenoid cartilages and portions of thyroid cartilage abutting these structures ending at the first appearance of the cricothyroid ligament
Each side separately starting at the superior articular surface near the zygoma bone and ending at the notch at the superior part of the ramus of the mandible
Based on the bony limits of the spinal canal starting superiorly at the bottom of the spinal cord (typically around L2) and ending at the inferior extent of the thecal sac (typically S3)

Outlining the space defined medially by the sacral foramina from S1-S3, including contouring within the sacral foramina, posteriorly along the limits of the true pelvis, laterally to 2-3 cm lateral to the sacral foramina, and anteriorly about 3-5 mm from the posterior limits of the contour
Include the mucosal, submucosa, and all muscular layers out to the fatty adventitia at least 10 cm superior and inferior to PTV

Each side separately from the spinal nerves exiting the neuroforamina from around C5 to T2 to include only the major trunks of the brachial plexus using the subclavian and axillary vessels as a surrogate for identifying its location extending proximally at the bifurcation of the brachiocephalic trunk into the jugular/subclavian veins (or carotid/subclavian arteries) and following along the route of the subclavian vein to the axillary vein ending after the neurovascular structures cross the second rib

Contoured along with the pericardial sac; the superior aspect (or base) for purposes of contouring will begin at the level of the inferior aspect of the aortic arch (aorto-pulmonary window) and extend inferiorly to the apex of the heart
The wall and lumen of the named vessel at least 10 cm superior and inferior to PTV
Contour the trachea and cartilage rings starting 10 cm superior to the PTV and extending inferior to the bronchi ending at the first bifurcation of the named lobar bronchus
The outer 0.5 cm of the body surface anywhere within the whole-body contour.
The entire stomach wall and the gastric contents included from the GE junction to the proximal duodenum at the pyloris
The entire duodenal wall and lumen from the pyloris to the duodenojejunal flexure
Any and all loops of small bowel as 1 structure within 10 cm of the PTV in any direction.
Each side separately, including major calyces, renal pelvis, and proximal renal artery medial to the aorta
One structure, including wall and contents of lumen starting 10 cm superior to PTV and ending 10 cm below PTV
One structure, including wall of rectum and all contents in lumen; start contouring 10 cm superior to PTV and then inferior to anal sphincter
Contour the bladder wall and all urine ending inferiorly at the base of the prostate
Contour the anterior inferior wall resting above and around the superior aspect of the pubic bone starting at the prostate inferiorly and extending 2-3 cm superiorly from there
Contour starting superiorly at the inferior aspect of the pelvic diaphragm (urethral sphincter) and extending inferiorly and anteriorly up to 3 cm
Contour both right and left separately
Contour right and left lung as 1 structure, including all parenchymal lung tissue but excluding the GTV and major airways (trachea and main/lobar bronchi)
Contour right and left lung as 1 structure, including all parenchymal lung tissue but excluding the GTV and major airways (trachea and main/lobar bronchi)
Contour right and left lobes as 1 structure, including all parenchymal liver tissue but excluding the GTV and major draining ducts, extrahepatic portal vein, and gall bladder
Contour right and left kidney as 1 structure, including all parenchymal capsular tissue but excluding the renal hilum/vascular trunk (see above)
